bibl.title: Letter from A. F. Xavier to Hugh L. Scott, August 9, 1901

div1.p: Xavier informs Scott that Caldas, inventor of a yellow fever serum, wants to conduct experiments in Havana. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Letter from A. F. Xavier to Hugh L. Scott, August 9, 1901
div1.opener:
BRAZILIAN CONSULATE GENERAL
New York, 9th August, 1901.
His Excellency Acting - Governor Scott,
Havana.
Cuba.
Sir:
div1.p:
This letter will be handed to your
Excellency by Dr. Philippi Caldas, the
brazilian physician referred to in
the telegram which I had the honor
of addressing to your Excellency on
the 9th instant.

✗ Dr. Caldas is the inventor of the
Anti-Yellow Fever Serum, and desires
to make experiments in Havana,
Dr Havard
which, with the kind protection,
which I respectfully beg of your
Excellency to extend to him, will
no doubt greatly benefit both
of our countries.

Thanking your Excellency in ad-
vance for whatever may be done
towards facilitating for Dr. Caldas the
performance of the above experiments
I have the honor to remain, sir,
div1.closer: Respectfully yours, A. F. Xavier Consul General
